snippet: A definitive decision on a telephone surveillance effort seems likely, but much else is unclear, as Supreme Court opinions have pointed in opposite directions.
abstract: Judge Richard J Leon's ruling on constitutionality of National Security Agency program that collects records of all Americans' phone calls faces uncertain path for appeal.
lead_paragraph: A definitive decision on a telephone surveillance effort seems likely, but much else is unclear, as Supreme Court opinions have pointed in opposite directions.

headline.main: After Ruling Critical of N.S.A., Uncertain Terrain for Appeal
headline.print_headline: After Ruling Critical of N.S.A., Uncertain Terrain for Appeal
